sentence: Why did the plane crash into the mountain? because the pilot was a loaf of bread.
explanation: A loaf is a type of baked bread. / A loaf can also refer to the act of loafing around, meaning to pass time in a lazy manner.
first_new_sentence: The bakery sells a variety of bread, including a fresh loaf of sourdough.
second_new_sentence: He decided to loaf around instead of studying for his exam.

sentence: What do you call someone addicted to both crack and weed? a rockin roller.
explanation: A roller can refer to a device that rolls. / A roller can also refer to a person who engages in recreational drug use.
first_new_sentence: The painter used a roller to apply the paint evenly on the wall.
second_new_sentence: He felt like a roller in life, constantly moving from one high to another.

sentence: I focused on identifying jokes with words that fit your criteria and created sentences reflecting two separate meanings for those words.
